content:
Diagnosis:
T3N0M0 mucoepidermoid carcinoma of right parotid gland

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Metformin 1g bd
Ramipril 5mg od

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Newly diagnosed salivary gland cancer with progressive symptoms

I reviewed [redacted name] today following recent investigations for a progressively enlarging right parotid mass. She initially noticed a small lump in December 2023 which has gradually increased in size, now measuring 4.2cm on recent imaging. She reports increasing discomfort and occasional sharp pains in the region, though no facial weakness. She has experienced some difficulty with mastication on the right side and notes intermittent pain radiating to the right ear.

MRI performed on 15 March 2024 showed a 4.2 x 3.8cm mass in the superficial lobe of the right parotid gland with deep lobe extension. FNA cytology from 20 March 2024 confirmed high-grade mucoepidermoid carcinoma. CT staging completed on 25 March 2024 showed no evidence of nodal involvement or distant metastases.

On examination today, there is a firm, relatively fixed mass in the right parotid region. No cervical lymphadenopathy is palpable. Facial nerve function remains intact on all branches. Performance status is 1 due to local symptoms affecting daily activities.

I have discussed the case with our head and neck MDT. The consensus recommendation is for primary surgical resection with facial nerve monitoring and potential sacrifice if involved, followed by adjuvant radiotherapy given the high-grade nature and T3 status. I have explained these recommendations to [redacted name] today, including the risks of facial nerve injury and other surgical complications. She will be reviewed by [redacted name] in the surgical clinic next week to discuss operative details.

The plan is for:
1. Surgical assessment next week
2. Aim for surgery within 2 weeks
3. Post-operative radiotherapy to be planned
4. Regular follow-up in combined head and neck clinic

primary_cancer.metastases: no evidence of nodal or distant metastases

cancer_timeline.value: Initial notice of small parotid lump
MRI shows 4.2 x 3.8cm mass in superficial lobe of right parotid with deep lobe extension
FNA cytology confirms high-grade mucoepidermoid carcinoma
CT staging shows no nodal involvement or distant metastases

patient_facts.value: Increasing discomfort and sharp pains in right parotid region
Difficulty with mastication on right side
Intermittent pain radiating to right ear
Firm, relatively fixed mass in right parotid region, no cervical lymphadenopathy, intact facial nerve function
PS 1 due to local symptoms affecting daily activities

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed T3N0M0 high-grade mucoepidermoid carcinoma of right parotid with progressive local symptoms. MDT recommendation for surgical resection followed by adjuvant radiotherapy
Regular follow-up planned in combined head and neck clinic
